column3: > @promag Is setAlreadyIncluded.count(childHash) the most common case? And, can its result be affected by the call to setChildren.insert(childIter).second?\n\n@murrayn the idea is to avoid the `childIter = mapTx.find` call, which `setChildren.insert(childIter)` depends on.
@promag It seems the first comment does not include any motivation and background.
@MarcoFalke improved first comment and reworded commit and PR title (removed `2nd`).

<!--5d09a71f8925f3f132321140b44b946d-->The last travis run for this pull request was 60 days ago and is thus outdated. To trigger a fresh travis build, this pull request should be closed and re-opened.
This change only saves some `mapTx` lookups, which in turn isn't that expensive considering the current size.

one effect of adding this here would be that `setChildren.insert` won't be called for those that are skipped here anymore, but since `setChildren` is locally declared and only used once below, it looks fine.\n\nThis change lgtm since it's only adding a check to be called earlier to avoid an unnecessary `mapTx.find()` call and the rest of the boolean looks the same.
Yes, I can insert in `setChildren` and still avoid the lookup though, but like you said, it's not needed.
